page.title: 14Transport-road,river,rail
page.content: The River Derwent can only be crossed by road at Cromford Bridge and Matlock Bridge(16th century).Most road traffic has to follow the A6 through the gorge This leads to traffic jams at busy periods.A narrower road,liable to sub- sidence, runs over the hill from Cromford to Matlock Green.At weekends Matlock Bath,a tourist centre,is visited by many motor-cyclists. Bus services from Matlock pass along the A6 to Cromford and other villages.They also come from Manchester and the N.W. to Derby, Nottingham and the M1. The A6 follows the valley floor of the R. Derwent,roads on either side involve steep hill climbs. The British Rail branch line from Ambergate to Matlock follows the valley by using two bridges and twom tunnels.There are stations at Cromford and Matlock Bath.
